text: The original reason was to make sure that `copy` copies columns (i.e. materializes them). But the change might have some additional side effects. Can you check what types the columns have after the operation you described. CC <@U681ELA87>

elements.text: The original reason was to make sure that
copies columns (i.e. materializes them). But the change might have some additional side effects. Can you check what types the columns have after the operation you described. CC

text:
After `DataFrame(Arrow.Table("mytable.arrow"), copycols = true)` I get:
```7-element Vector{DataType}:
 Vector{String} (alias for Array{String, 1})
 Vector{Date} (alias for Array{Date, 1})
 Vector{Date} (alias for Array{Date, 1})
 Vector{Union{Missing, String}} (alias for Array{Union{Missing, String}, 1})
 Vector{Union{Missing, String}} (alias for Array{Union{Missing, String}, 1})
 PooledArrays.PooledVector{String, Int8, Vector{Int8}} (alias for PooledArrays.PooledArray{String, Int8, 1, Array{Int8, 1}})
 Vector{Int64} (alias for Array{Int64, 1})```

elements.text:
7-element Vector{DataType}:
 Vector{String} (alias for Array{String, 1})
 Vector{Date} (alias for Array{Date, 1})
 Vector{Date} (alias for Array{Date, 1})
 Vector{Union{Missing, String}} (alias for Array{Union{Missing, String}, 1})
 Vector{Union{Missing, String}} (alias for Array{Union{Missing, String}, 1})
 PooledArrays.PooledVector{String, Int8, Vector{Int8}} (alias for PooledArrays.PooledArray{String, Int8, 1, Array{Int8, 1}})
 Vector{Int64} (alias for Array{Int64, 1})
